com.viaoa.util

Class OAConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.viaoa.util.OAConverter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    OAConv

    public class OAConverter
extends Object
    Conversion class for converting Objects from one form to another. Most common usage is to convert Objects to Strings, String to Objects, Formatting, Decimal Arithmetic.

    contains two key static methods: toString(Object, format) & toObject(class, String, format)

    See Also:
    OAConverterNumber, OAConverterOADate, OAString.format(), OADate

      • getDateFormat

        public static String getDateFormat()
        Default format to use for dates.

        Note: OAConverter.toString() will not automatically use this format unless it is sent as a parameter. This method is to be used as a global area for other APIs to store default system formatting. Note: OADate is used for formatting dates and has its own default formatting if one is not supplied.

        See Also:
        for format options and default formatting/parsing values

      • getBooleanFormat

        public static String getBooleanFormat()
        default format to use for boolean values when converted to a String.

        Note: OAConverter.toString() will not automatically use this format unless it is sent as a parameter. This method is to be used as a global area for other APIs to store default system formatting. param fmt is a String with a semicolon seperating the three values "true;false;null" Example: ("true;false");

      • round

        public static double round(double d,
                           int accurateDecimalPlaces,
                           int decimalPlaces,
                           int roundType)
        Uses BigDecimal to round number to "decimalPlaces" amount of decimal numbers.

        Notes:
        Since doubles are floating point numbers, there is a chance for loss of precision.
        For rounding, this could cause a problem when the digit that is being removed should be a 5, in which case the previous digit might need to be changed based on the type of rounding that is being performed (ex: BigDecimal.ROUND_HALF_UP, ROUND_HALF_DOWN, etc.).

        Floating point numbers mostly lose precision when being used for a lot of calculations.

        Example: a number "1.5" could be represented as "1.499999" or "1.500001" as a double.
        The round method allows you to specify the number of decimal places that you know the number currently should have. The round method will first round the number to this amount of decimal places before performing the round. SEE: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2808535/round-a-double-to-2-decimal-places

        Parameters:
        accurateDecimalPlaces - is number of decimal places that number should have. See note above.
        decimalPlaces - is number of decimal places that number needs to be rounded to.
        roundType - is type of rounding to perform. See BigDecimal for types of rounding, ex: BigDecimal.ROUND_HALF_UP
        See Also:
        BigDecimal

      • round

        public static double round(double d,
                           int accurateDecimalPlaces,
                           int decimalPlaces)
        Uses BigDecimal to round number to "decimalPlaces" amount of decimal numbers.

        By Default, uses BigDecimal.ROUND_HALF_UP.

        Parameters:
        accurateDecimalPlaces - is number of decimal places that number should have. See note above.
        decimalPlaces - number of decimal places to round to
        See Also:
        Notes about rounding, BigDecimal

      • round

        public static double round(double d,
                           int decimalPlaces)
        Uses BigDecimal to round number to "decimalPlaces" amount of decimal numbers.

        By Default, uses BigDecimal.ROUND_HALF_UP.

        Parameters:
        decimalPlaces - number of decimal places to round to
        See Also:
        Notes about rounding, BigDecimal

      • convert

        public static Object convert(Class clazz,
                             Object value,
                             String fmt)
        Convert an object "value" to another type "clazz" using a format "fmt"

        This will call getConverter(clazz). If the converter is null or it returns a null, then getConverter(value.getClass()) will be called.

        Note: If clazz is String and value is null, then a blank String "" is returned.

        Parameters:
        fmt - is format to use for parsing/formatting. returns converted object of type clazz or null if converstion can not be done.
        See Also:
        getConverter(java.lang.Class)

      • convert

        public static Object convert(Class clazz,
                             Object value)
        Convert an Object to another type "clazz".
        Returns:
        converted object of type clazz or null if conversion could not be completed.
        See Also:
        convert(Class,Object,String)

      • toString

        public static String toString(Object obj)
        Convert an Object to a String, without formatting.
        Returns:
        if obj is null then a blank string is returned, otherwise String version of obj.
        See Also:
        convert(Class,Object,String)

                              String fmt)

        Returns:

      • toString

        public static String toString(boolean b,
                              String fmt)
        Convert boolean value to a String.
        Parameters:
        fmt - format string to determine values for true, false, null. Ex: "true;false;null", "yes;no;maybe"
        Returns:
        String version of a boolean
        See Also:
        OAConverterBoolean, convert(Class,Object,String), OAString.format(String,String)

      • toString

        public static String toString(boolean b,
                              boolean bUseDefaultFormat)

      • toString

        public static String toString(Boolean b,
                              String fmt)
        Convert boolean value to a String.
        Parameters:
        b - boolean value, can be null if used as "(Boolean) null"
        fmt - format string to determine values for true, false, null. Ex: "true;false;null", "yes;no;maybe"
        Returns:
        String version of a boolean
        See Also:
        OAConverterBoolean, convert(Class,Object,String), OAString.format(String,String)

      • toString

        public static String toString(boolean b)
        Convert boolean value to a String, using Boolean(b).toString()
        See Also:
        toString(boolean,String), toString(Boolean,String), convert(Class,Object,String)
